news.title: Uber Agrees to Pay $4.4 Million to Settle EEOC Sexual Harassment and Retaliation Charge
news.description: Following a finding by the EEOC that Uber allowed a culture of sexual harassment and retaliation, the company will pay $4.4 million to victims and face three years of monitoring.

news.title: Trump Administration Says Employers Can Ban Organizing Via Company Email
news.description: The National Labor Relations Board has ruled that employees can be prohibited from using their work email for union organizing, overturning an Obama-era ruling stating the opposite.

news.title: Feds Reap Data From 1,500 Phones in Largest Reported Reverse-Location Warrant
news.description: In an effort to solve four Wisconsin arson cases, federal investigators secured search warrants allowing them access to location history data for about 1,500 smartphones.
